de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractListDialog.Builder<DialogType extends AbstractListDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractListDialog.Builder<DialogType,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialog.Builder<DialogType,BuilderType>
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractValidateableDialog.Builder<DialogType,BuilderType>
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractButtonBarDialog.Builder<DialogType,BuilderType>
          • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractListDialog.Builder<DialogType,BuilderType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DialogType - The type of the dialog, which is created by the builder
    BuilderType - The type of the builder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MaterialDialog.Builder
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractListDialog

    protected abstract static class AbstractListDialog.Builder<DialogType extends AbstractListDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractListDialog.Builder<DialogType,?>>
extends AbstractButtonBarDialog.Builder<DialogType,BuilderType>
    An abstract base class for all builders, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder(android.content.Context context)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.
      Builder(android.content.Context context, int themeResourceId)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context,
               @StyleRes
               int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

      • setItemColor

        public final BuilderType setItemColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the list items of the dialog, which is created by the builder.
        Parameters:
        color - The color, which should be set, as an Integer value or -1, if no custom color should be set
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • setItems

        public final BuilderType setItems(@NonNull
                                  java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                                  @Nullable
                                  android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the items, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

        Parameters:

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        public final BuilderType setSingleChoiceItems(@NonNull
                                              java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                                              int checkedItem,
                                              @Nullable
                                              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder. Only one of the items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • setSingleChoiceItems

                                              int resourceId,
                                              int checkedItem,
                                              @Nullable
                                              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder. Only one of the items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

                                              android.widget.ListAdapter adapter,
                                              int checkedItem,
                                              @Nullable
                                              android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the adapter, which provides the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder. Only one of the items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter, which should be set, as an instance of the type ListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        public final BuilderType setMultiChoiceItems(@NonNull
                                             java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                                             @Nullable
                                             boolean[] checkedItems,
                                             @Nullable
                                             android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder. Multiple items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        public final BuilderType setMultiChoiceItems(@ArrayRes
                                             int resourceId,
                                             @Nullable
                                             boolean[] checkedItems,
                                             @Nullable
                                             android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder. Multiple items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • setOnItemSelectedListener

        public final BuilderType setOnItemSelectedListener(@Nullable
                                                   android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when an item, which is shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder, is selected.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType
